issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
{html}

Platform: Android

Currently the hasChild graphic (and hasDetail, when it is implemented for Android) is shown at a set distance from the right hand edge of the table, and it is currently not affected by the "right" property. A way to line these up with graphics in other rows would be useful.

{html}
fields.summary: Ability to pad hasCheck & hasDetail graphics in tableViewRow, to allow then to line up with other graphics

comments.body:
{html}

I have to mark this as invalid. The indicators are not part of the "content" region of the row. It's a feature we inherited from iphone. You cannot adjust the placement. So when an indicator is added what it does is shrink the content region however much it needs to.

It might be best if you hop on IRC or open a Q&A issue first before creating tickets or feature requests. We really only want committed items to be tracked in lighthouse.

{html}

{html}

OK, Don, I understand the need to close this ticket.

I also appreciate what you are saying about feature requests. To be fair, this is the first of my tickets that have been marked as invalid, from what I can tell.

Have you considered something like https://uservoice.com/ (or better still, something similar that is integrated into your current user accounts) to allow users to raise feature requests without diluting your other systems while at the same time helping you to better understand popular user needs?

Cheers

{html}

{html}

It doesn't get used often but the Google Group is used for features. Q&A is probably the next best place. There are usually several people in #titanium_dev on irc.freenode.net where we talk about dev related issues as well.

{html}
